taskbody.context: As a Quality engineer, you define the disposition plan for defects in the Submitted status.
taskbody.prereq: Ensure that you have configured the required disposition action reason tree in the Plant Applications Administrator, and then linked the disposition action reason tree for selection in the application by using an appropriate script file.

step.cmd: Access the defect that you want to dispose.

info.note: You can dispose a defect only if it is in the Submitted status, indicated by , in the Home page.

step.cmd: Click for the defect you want to dispose.
In the Select Disposition drop-down list box, select an option as described in the following table.

row.entry: Select Clear if the defect is considered as Not a Defect.

entry.p: Select Continue to process to allow operation on the non-conforming part and then select the operation till which you can continue the operations process, in the Select operation drop-down list box.

row.entry: Select Use as is to use the non-conforming part in the operations as it is.

entry.p: Select Scrap to discard the defective lot.
Select Rework to rework on the non-conforming part and then select the operation on which the part should be reworked in the Select operation drop-down list box.

step.cmd: In the Select reasons window, select a corrective disposition action reason and the associated subreasons, as applicable.

info.note: In the Search box, enter a disposition action reason to search for, and then select the reason from the reasons list.

step.cmd: In the ADDITIONAL INFORMATION box, enter any relevant information such as a URL, contact details of the supplier, or any information that is helpful to perform the root cause analysis of the non-conformance.

taskbody.result:
Following actions take place based on the selected disposition:
Disposition TypeResult
Clear
The status of the defect is set to Not a Defect, indicated by
The hold on the serial or material lot number and the operation on which the defect was created is released.
The hold on all future operations associated with the serial or material lot number is released.
Continue to process
The status of the defect is Active, indicated by . The status of the defect is automatically changed to Submitted after completion of the operations till the selected operation (the operation till which you want to continue to process).
The hold on the serial or material lot number is released. The serial or material lot number is again on hold after completion of the operations till the selected operation.
The hold on all operations associated with the serial or material lot number till the selected operation is released in the Operations application.
The hold on the selected operation and the future operations is not yet released.
Use as is
The status of the defect is set to Closed, indicated by .
The hold on the serial or material lot number and the operation on which the defect was created is released.
The hold on all operations associated with the serial or material lot number is released.
ScrapWhen you select this disposition method for the defect, the following actions take place:
The status of the defect is set to Closed, indicated by .
The hold on the serial or material lot number and the operation on which the defect was created is released in the Operations application.
The hold on all operations associated with the serial or material lot number is released in the Operations application.
ReworkWhen you select this disposition method for the defect, the following actions take place:
The status of the defect is changed to Active, indicated by . After completion of rework the status is changed to
The hold on the serial or material lot number is released and the hold on the rework operation is released.
The hold on all other operations associated with the serial or material lot number is not yet released. The hold is released after completion of rework.
